the_frog_and_the_ox.title: The Frog and the Ox
the_frog_and_the_ox.description: A frog, envious of the size of an ox, tries to inflate herself to match the ox's size. She puffs up more and more until she bursts.

choice.option: Think about the consequences of your reaction

the_fox_and_the_grapes.title: The Fox and the Grapes
the_fox_and_the_grapes.description: A fox tries repeatedly to get some grapes hanging high on the vine but cannot reach them. Instead of admitting defeat, he states they are undesirable because they must be sour.

the_tortoise_and_the_hare.title: The Tortoise and the Hare
the_tortoise_and_the_hare.description: A hare ridicules a slow-moving tortoise. Tired of the hare's boastful behavior, the tortoise challenges him to a race. The hare soon leaves the tortoise behind and, confident of winning, takes a nap midway through the race. The tortoise then plods along and wins the race.

the_ant_and_the_grasshopper.title: The Ant and the Grasshopper
the_ant_and_the_grasshopper.description: In summer, the grasshopper frolics while the ant works hard, storing food for winter. When winter comes, the grasshopper finds himself without food and starves, while the ant is prepared.

the_wind_and_the_sun.title: The Wind and the Sun
the_wind_and_the_sun.description: The wind and the sun argue about which of them is stronger. They spot a man walking, and decide that whichever of them can get the man to remove his coat is the stronger element. The wind blows fiercely, but the man only wraps his coat tighter. The sun shines warmly, causing the man to remove his coat.

the_boy_who_cried_wolf.title: The Boy Who Cried Wolf
the_boy_who_cried_wolf.description: A boy tending sheep falsely alarms the villagers that a wolf is attacking the flock. Twice he does this for fun, and the villagers come running. The third time, a wolf truly comes, but the villagers do not believe the boy's cries for help and the flock is scattered.

the_milkmaid_and_her_pail.title: The Milkmaid and Her Pail
the_milkmaid_and_her_pail.description: A milkmaid carries a pail of milk on her head, dreaming of what she'll buy with the money from selling the milk. She plans to buy some chickens, which will lay eggs, which she'll sell to buy a fancy dress to wear to the market. Lost in daydreams, she spills the milk.

the_goose_that_laid_the_golden_eggs.title: The Goose That Laid the Golden Eggs
the_goose_that_laid_the_golden_eggs.description: A man and his wife have a goose that lays a golden egg every day. Thinking the goose has a stash of gold inside her, they kill the goose to get all the gold at once, only to find the goose is just like any other goose inside.

the_dog_and_the_shadow.title: The Dog and the Shadow
the_dog_and_the_shadow.description: A dog carrying a bone crosses a bridge and sees its reflection in the water below. Thinking it's another dog with a bigger bone, he opens his mouth to bark at it, dropping his real bone into the water.

the_lion_and_the_mouse.title: The Lion and the Mouse
the_lion_and_the_mouse.description: A lion catches a mouse that begs for its life, promising to repay the lion's mercy. The lion, amused, lets the mouse go. Later, the lion is caught in a net, and the mouse gnaws through the ropes to set the lion free.
